choices: The Warden Doesn't Let You Leave
1.content:
The smell of industrial cleaner and despair invaded your nostrils as you were pushed down the long hallway that was lined with prison cells. You kept looking straight ahead as prisoners jeered and called out at you from their cages. You caught words like "Nice Ass" and "All Night Long" in the loud roar of the prisoners but you kept your cool and just trudged through. You reached the end of the hall and were led to a large wooden door that had a plaque with the word "WARDEN" carved in it. You were half pushed, half carried through the doorway and forcefully sat down in a chair in front of a large desk. Behind this desk was a chair that was turned around to prevent you from seeing who was behind it. The guards left, shutting the door behind them, and left you all alone with the figure sitting in the chair.

After a moment of silence a voice from behind the chair spoke. "Good evening Mr. ... ah well I suppose your name doesn't matter anymore, at least not in here." The chair turned around revealing the warden. He was a very large man, he looked very much like a lumberjack, dressed in a cheap suit instead of a plaid jacket. His head was balding, but his beard was still full. He showed his shiny white teeth when he smiled at you, it was a smile you'd very much like to forget. "I'm glad you made it here in one piece, you look like you'll make a great addition to our fine establishment here." After a moment of silence he continued. "Ah the silent type. You'll soon find that it would be better if we were friends, after all, I can make your stay here very uncomfortable if I wanted to." Looking up you caught his eyes and stared at him with a slight worried look. "But I don't think that will be necessary right now. No, instead I think it would be best to get you acquainted with your new house guests. You'll be living with them for, oh I don't really remember. Was it 5 years or 50? So hard to keep all these files in order you know.

The warden pressed a button on his desk and the two guards that brought you in open the door and stood beside your chair. "Seeing how it is your first day and all, I feel like being a little generous. I'll let you pick where you want to go. But there are so many choices, what will you choose?"

If you are hungry you could always head on down to the cafeteria. It's a little late but you might be able to snag some of the food that's left.

Maybe you want to go out and lift some weights? The fresh air could do you some good and let you meet all your fellow inmates here.

You do smell from the long bus ride here with no air conditioning. A shower does sound a little nice right now.

The long ride kind of tiered you out. You should probably head to your cell and make yourself at home. Seems like you're going to be here for a while.

"So. Where would you like to go?" The warden asked with a glint in his eye.
1.title: Enter the Doghouse

11.content:
You haven't eaten all day and the pain in your stomach told you exactly where you needed to go.
"Alright then," The warden motioned and the two guards walked you out of his office. "Be sure to give my best to our cooks."

The guards uncuffed your hands and feet and led you down a winding series of halls before you arrived at the cafeteria. The room was half filled with inmates finishing their food and making their ways to other parts of the prison. All eyes were on you as you walked over to the end of the line. Surprisingly the food didn't look that bad. You were expecting slop with a side of ketchup, but it looked more like what you would find at a high school. After filling your tray with fruit, milk and a burger you then realized that you had a problem. Where were you going to sit?

Looking around you saw that the prison was filled with group of all sorts and sizes. Not wanting to join anyone and make yourself a target you simply found a table by itself and sat down. You started to chow down on your burger when a dead silence dropped over the entire room. You stopped chewing and swallowed hard as several pairs of footsteps came up from behind you. Four men sat down at your table, surrounding you. Taking a look around you realized that these guys were from each of the different groups around the cafeteria.

The first man to your right was named Caleb and he was huge, as in you could probably get lost in his stomach huge. Caleb was part of the Chubby Syndicate. This group had only one thing on its mind: food. Smuggling in delicious treats was what they did around these parts, but the snacks came at a price. (Weight Gain)

The second man at the table was Mike. This guy looked like he could bench press a bus, he looked like he didn't have a bit of fat on him. Mike was from the Muscle Mafia. This organizations only interest was working out and getting bigger. These guys were so big that the guards had to keep a special eye on them. (Muscle Gain)

The next guy was Stan from the Size Brotherhood. Stan surprisingly looked completely normal, that is until you saw something moving around in his shirt pocket. You may have been seeing things, but you thought you saw a tiny set of hands reach out. This brotherhood was obsessed with changing the size of their bodies. Sometimes they even shrunk down other inmates to teach them a lesson. (Shrinking / Growing)

The last man at the table was just a normal looking guy. His name was Oscar and his group was the Others. They weren't very well know and you have no idea what they did. It could be anything. (Animal, Inanimate, Age, Transgender, Etc.)

After you looked around at each of the groups Caleb piped up and said, “You gotta pick one of us buddy boy. You won’t last long without a group.
You stared at each of the men in front of you and weighed your options. Choosing the wrong group could make you some enemies, but it could get you some friends too and that was what you needed right now.
11.title: The Cafeteria

113.content: You look around at each group once more. In the end you decide to go with the size brotherhood. "I'll go with Stan." You say as the other groups get up and leave. "Glad you chose us buddy boy." Stan says as he walks you to the table where the rest of the guys are at. "This is the new recruit be nice don't want to scare him away." Stan tells the group as he introduces you. "Who is going to welcome him into the group?" You hear one of the group members say. "Well first things first he needs to swallow the pill." Stan said as he turned to you and gave you a pill. As you take it you swallow it not wanting to look bad in front of your new group of friends. "What's going to happen now?" 115.content:
Before you could answer, a loud ringing sound filled the cafeteria. It wasn't long before guards rushed into the cafeteria yelling at the inmates to line up along the wall with their hands up. You followed the crowd and got shoved into the line, doing what everyone else did. The guy to your left was a big man that stood over a foot taller than you and had a face that made you want to run the other way. He looked over at you staring up at him and gave you the most sinister smile you've ever seen. Don't think you want to spend too much time around him. On your right, however, was a man a little shorter than you that didn't seem so menacing. You looked over at him and finally spoke up. "Hay, what's going on?"
The man looked you over for a second with a questioning look before responding. "We're under lock down. Something must have happened out in the yard and now we all have to line up until everything is under control." You nodded in understanding and looked forward at the wall in front of you.
"So what's going to happen now?"
"Well, three things could happen. #1. It could be a false alarm and everyone goes back to eating. #2. It could have been a drill, which means we would all go back to our own cells. #3. There might have been a fight out in the yard, and that means we'd all have to be searched... Very Thoroughly!"
Well that didn't sound good. Just as he finished talking, the guards behind you spoke up telling everyone to...

14.content:
It does feel nice knowing where you are going to live, especially if you're going to be here for potentially the rest of your life.
         "I would like to check out my cell, thank you very much."
         The warden uncuffs your hands and feet and several staff escort you. Your cell number is A-580.
         The staff drop you off at your cell. They open the door, and leave after you go in.
         It seems that you share your cell with another inmate. He is sitting down on a double-bunk bed, and there are buckets in your cell as toilets. You can see the cells beside you, as they are just separated by metal bars.
         The inmate in your cell introduces himself, telling you that his name is James. James is larger than you, at 5'10, and is also buff. You tell him your name.

info.brief_description: You've just been put in prison for a crime that you may or may not have commit. Good luck.
info.description:
You've just been put in prison for a crime that you may or may not have commit. You're in the jail house now, and you have to decide how your stay is going to go. Good luck.

I'm going to try and leave the choices up to the reader as much as possible. You will get to choose what you look like, what crime you committed, and what happens to you. Try to keep it as dirty as possible. Will you become top dog or someone's bitch? The choice is yours.
